# UIPointerStyle

**Class**

An object that defines the pointer shape and effect.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIPointerStyle
```

## Overview

Whenever possible, match pointer styles to UIKit styles and make them consistent with the visual intent of similar views.



For more information, see [https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/inputs/pointing-devices/].

## Creating a pointer style

- **init(effect:shape:)**: Applies the provided content effect and pointer shape to the current region.
- **init(shape:constrainedAxes:)**: Morphs the pointer into the provided shape when hovering over the current region.
- **hidden()**: Hides the pointer when it moves over the current region.
- **system()**: Morphs the pointer into a default system-style pointer.

## Specifying pointer accessories

- **accessories**: Accessories to display alongside the pointer.
- **UIPointerAccessory**: Constants that describe accessories to display alongside the primary pointer.

## Pointer styles

- **UIPointerShape**: An object that defines the shape of custom pointers.
- **UIPointerEffect**: An effect that alters a view’s appearance when a pointer enters the current region.
- **UIPointerAccessory**: Constants that describe accessories to display alongside the primary pointer.
